e4: Switching to the unbiased reporting policy aligns with ethical practices and legal standards, reducing potential legal and regulatory threats. It advocates for transparency which can enhance long-term credibility with investors. Despite short-term misunderstandings, diligent communication with stakeholders will facilitate comprehension of the changes, fostering informed decision-making and sustainable investor relations.
e5: An ethical reporting policy emphasizes transparency, truthfulness, and equity by accurately reporting financial data without unjustified manipulation for strategic gains. It should comply with legal standards, minimize ambiguity for all investor types, and prevent bias that can cause disadvantages.
